metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2800 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A specially crafted x509 certificate can cause a single out of bounds byte overwrite in wolfSSL through 3.10.2 resulting in potential certificate validation vulnerabilities, denial of service and possible remote code execution. In order to trigger this vulnerability, the attacker needs to supply a malicious x509 certificate to either a server or a client application using this library.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2800` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl15 - 3.13.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.13.0+dfsg-1').
